title: Obscuriosities
description: The podcast about obscure video games. Do you believe that there's value in the unknown?
user_comment: The podcast about obscure video games. Do you believe that there's value in the unknown?

items.title: Episode 1: The Post-Pokémon Gold Rush
items.content_text: Episode page: https://podcast.obskyr.io/episode-1-the-post-pok%C3%A9mon-gold-rush/On this inaugural episode of Obscuriosities, we talk about mon games – games inspired to ride the coattails of Pokémon’s creature-collecting craze. But of course, unlike a Digimon or a Monster Rancher… these games didn’t make it big.Today, we explore Kotobattle: Tengai no Moribito (Game Boy Color), Kanzume Monsters (Game Boy), Kanzume Monsters: Parfait (Game Boy Color), Kaseki Sōsei Reborn (Game Boy), and Kaseki Sōsei Reborn II: Monster Digger (Game Boy Color).
items.content_html:
Episode page: https://podcast.obskyr.io/episode-1-the-post-pok%C3%A9mon-gold-rush/

On this inaugural episode of Obscuriosities, we talk about mon games – games inspired to ride the coattails of Pokémon’s creature-collecting craze. But of course, unlike a Digimon or a Monster Rancher… these games didn’t make it big.

Today, we explore Kotobattle: Tengai no Moribito (Game Boy Color), Kanzume Monsters (Game Boy), Kanzume Monsters: Parfait (Game Boy Color), Kaseki Sōsei Reborn (Game Boy), and Kaseki Sōsei Reborn II: Monster Digger (Game Boy Color).
